body.p: The above is an example usage of kplot, an ISO C, ISC-licensed UNIX programming library for plotting graphs on a Cairo surface. It handles drawing margins, axis labels, tic labels, tics, borders, grids, and the data itself. Data may be specified structurally as finite buckets, range histograms, arrays, and vectors. Data may also be computed from other sources, such as the mean and standard deviation. For a complete reference, consult kplot(3). Download sources from kplot.tgz (current version @VERSION@, sha512) or browse the archive. kplot is a BSD.lv project.
